intro: Streptanthus morrisonii subsp. hirtiflorus, commonly known as the hairy-flowered stinkcup, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are usually hairy and serrated. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy floral stems, which give it its common name.
